data.title: Keisei Skyliner Guide: from Narita Airport (NRT) to Tokyo & Save 3%
data.meta_description: Find everything you need about Keisei Skyliner to transfer from Narita Airport to Tokyo. Trip.com offers a 3% Off on Skyliner tickets, check now!
data.text:
Hey Friends! Looking for the quickest route from Narita Airport to Tokyo? Take the Keisei Skyliner!! It's the fastest route to the city center, avoiding any extra transfers. Just swap your voucher at the ticket counter and head to Ueno. Enjoy the ride in its comfortable, spacious seats and sleek design, speeding you directly into Tokyo!

Best Keisei Skyliner Products-Enjoy 3% Off

3% off any option when you book Skyliner Ticket between Mar 5, 2024 and Nov 1, 2024

Promo stocks are limited, so get in quick before they run out!

What is Keisei Skyliner Express

The Keisei Skyliner Railway offers a direct express train service between Narita International Airport and Ueno/Nippori Station, with no stops in between. The Skyliner trains run every 20 minutes. This service allows passengers to reach downtown Tokyo quickly and directly.

Keisei Skyliner Ticket Fare

Trip.com offers an exclusive 3% discount on all Skyliner ticket options when booked between March 5, 2024, and October 31, 2024, but hurry as promo stocks are limited!

Package TypeOriginal Price (US$)DiscountTotal (US$)Check Now!Child$7.583% (-$0.23)$7.35Check Now!Adult$15.233% (-$0.46)$14.77Check Now!

【Note】

*Prices in this table are special prices on Trip.com as of April 10th, 2024.

Keisei Skyliner Route Map

【Skyliner Route from Narita Airport: Narita Airport Terminals 1, 2 & 3 > Shin-Kamagaya > Aoto > Nippori > Keisei-Ueno】

【Skyliner Route from Ueno Station: Keisei-Ueno > Nippori > Aoto > Shin-Kamagaya > Narita Airport Terminals 2 & 3, Terminal 1】

Departure & Terminal StationTime RequiredDetails about SkylinerNarita Airport to Ueno Station36 minutesCheck Detail HereNarita Airport to Nippori Station41 minutesCheck Detail Here

【Note】The times indicated are for fastest time between Narita Airport Terminal 2-3 Station and each station.

Where to Buy Keisei Skyliner Ticket

There are several ways to purchase Skyliner tickets, with the most convenient and cost-effective option being online through Trip.com.

Online/OfflineDescriptionOnlineBuy Skyliner tickets on Trip.com and get a 3% discount.OfflineTickets available at:

- Skyliner Ticket Counters at Narita Airport Terminals 1 and 2⋅3;

- SKYLINER & KEISEI INFORMATION CENTER;

- Keisei Electric Railway Ticket Sales Counter at Narita Airport Terminals 1 and 2, 1F.Skyliner Tickets also available at Nippori, Keisei-Ueno, Aoto, and Shin-Kamagaya Stations.

How to Book Skyliner Ticket via Vending Machine

1. Select “Liner Ticket.”

2. Choose your destination (e.g., Narita Airport Terminal 1).

3. Select the number of tickets (e.g., one adult ticket).

4. For Skyliner travel, buy a regular passenger ticket and an express ticket. Select “Liner ticket & Keisei Line passenger ticket” for both, or “Liner ticket only purchase” if you have a passenger ticket.

5. Complete payment using cash, credit card, or a prepaid train card (IC card).

Skyliner Ticket Exchange Places

Here are the key locations where you can exchange your vouchers for Skyliner tickets:

To Narita Airport:

【Keisei Ueno Station】> Skyliner ticket vending machine or Skyliner ticket counter

【Nippori Station】> Skyliner ticket vending machine or JR transfer ticket counter

To Keisei Ueno Station:

【Narita Airport Station (Narita Terminal 1)】> Skyliner ticket machine or Skyliner ticket counter

【Airport Terminal 2 (Narita Terminal 2 and 3)】> Skyliner ticket machines or Skyliner ticket counters

【Narita Airport Terminal】> Keisei Electric Railway Ticket Counter

Keisei Skyliner Station Map

After buying your Skyliner ticket online, you can swap it for an actual ticket at specific Skyliner vending machines or ticket counters. Below are maps of Skyliner stations to help you find your way easily.

【Narita Airport Terminal 1 Map】

Source: Keisei Electric Railway Official

【Narita Airport Terminal 2,3 Map】

Source: Keisei Electric Railway Official

【Keisei-Ueno Station Map】

Source: Keisei Electric Railway Official

Keisei Skyliner Timetable

【Timetable: Narita Airport Terminals 1, 2 & 3 > Shin-Kamagaya > Aoto > Nippori > Keisei-Ueno】

Source: Keisei Electric Railway Official

【Timetable: Keisei-Ueno > Nippori > Aoto > Shin-Kamagaya > Narita Airport Terminals 2 & 3, Terminal 1】

Source: Keisei Electric Railway Official

【Note】

When purchasing your Keisei Skyliner ticket online, please be aware of the following guidelines to ensure a smooth travel experience:

Your e-voucher must be exchanged for a physical ticket and seat reservation at designated counters before boarding. Boarding with just an e-voucher is not permitted.

Physical tickets for a specific date and train are only available for collection on the day you've selected during booking.

It's important to use correct traveler information matching real-name registration requirements at the time of booking. Incorrect information could lead to problems or losses for travelers.

Once you've redeemed your e-voucher for a ticket, refunds are not available, unless the train service is cancelled.

In the event of a service cancellation, Jingcheng Electric Railway will provide a stop certificate. You can use this certificate to request a refund at ticket counters.

For any situations not covered by your voucher or mentioned here, the Skyliner's official regulations will apply.

Should I Choose Keisei Skyliner Express?

Benefits of the Keisei Skyliner

AspectDetailHigh SpeedTravels at 160 km/h between Narita Airport and Ueno.Frequent ServiceOffers three departures per hour, every 20 minutes.Direct TravelProvides a non-stop route to central Tokyo.Comfortable RideClean and comfortable interior for passengers.

Drawbacks of the Keisei Skyliner

AspectDetailLimited DestinationsMainly serves Ueno/Nippori, inconvenient for some.Platform WaitingLacks seating facilities at platforms for waiting passengers.

【Advice】

The Keisei Skyliner is most suitable for travelers who prioritize speed and comfort, heading directly to or from the Ueno/Nippori area. Its high-speed service and frequent departures make it an excellent choice for those on a tight schedule or preferring minimal hassle after a long flight.

However, for those staying in areas far from Ueno/Nippori, the Skyliner might not be the most convenient. In such cases, alternatives like the Narita Express, which serves a broader range of destinations across Tokyo, or local trains for a more budget-friendly journey, might be preferable.

Additionally, travelers with heavy luggage might find taxis more convenient despite the higher cost, due to direct hotel drop-offs.

Keisei Skyliner Express Train Comfortable Interior

FeatureDescriptionInterior CabinOffers an open, spacious design with ambient lighting and a high domed ceiling, creating a bright, welcoming atmosphere. Passengers enjoy such comfort, they might wish the 40-minute trip to downtown Tokyo were longer.VestibulesGlass doors and Japan's traditional ichimatsu pattern in a wave-like design on the floors enhance the open, spacious feel with bright lighting.SeatsErgonomically designed with a pitch of 41.3 inches and a width of 18.5 inches, each equipped with a power outlet for devices.Luggage StorageAmple space provided between cabins, with security cameras installed for added safety and peace of mind.

Source from: Keisei Electric Railway Official: Open and spacious cabin

Source from: Keisei Electric Railway Official: Storage space for luggage

Source from: Keisei Electric Railway Official: Spacious vestibules

Transport Options from Narita Airport to Tokyo

Getting to or from an airport can be tough if there aren’t many ways to travel. However, Narita Airport has so many options that it can be even confusing to choose, especially if you’ve just come off a long flight. Luckily, Trip.com has put together options to help you enter Tokyo easily!

TransportExpenditure (USD)Travel TimeFrequencyAdviceCheck Now!Narita Express (N'EX)From $108.37Approx. 55 minsEvery 25 to 40 minsBest for those close to JR stations, seeking quick access to Tokyo with the flexibility of the JR Rail Pass.Check Now!Keisei SkylinerFrom $14.7736 minsEvery 20 minsIdeal for quick, direct journeys to Ueno/Nippori, offering speed and comfort for travelers on a tight schedule.Check Now!Airport Limousine BusFrom $9.23Approx. 60 minsHourlySuitable for direct hotel connections, favored by those prioritizing convenience over cost and staying near bus stops.Check Now!Taxi (Rental Type)$135 to $216Approx. 1h 30mOn-demandPreferred for a private, direct experience, especially for those with more luggage or less concern for expense.Check Now!

【Pros & Cons of Different Transport Options】

Narita Express

Benefits: Covers a broader range of destinations in Tokyo and offers comfort similar to the Skyliner. If you have a JR Rail Pass, it’s a cost-effective option.

Drawbacks: Complexity due to trains splitting destinations and the need to ensure boarding the correct section of the train.

Buses

Benefits: staying at or near specific hotels served by the Limousine Bus.

Drawbacks: subject to traffic delays and less frequent departures, so it is potentially slower and less predictable than other transport options.

Local Trains

Benefits: Cheaper options available, offering savings for budget-conscious travelers.

Drawbacks: Slower with more stops and potentially more confusing with multiple lines and transfers required.

Taxis

Benefits: Direct drop-off at hotels can be more convenient for those with heavy luggage.

Drawbacks: Generally slower due to road traffic and more expensive than train options.

Top Attrations Around Skyliner Stations

Ueno Station

Ueno Zoo: Dive into the world of wildlife at Japan's oldest zoo, home to over 3,000 animals including the rare giant panda. Lush greenery and historic structures make it a peaceful retreat in the heart of Tokyo.

Tokyo National Museum: As the oldest and largest museum in Japan, it houses a comprehensive collection of art and archeological artifacts from Japan and Asia. A must-visit for history buffs looking to immerse themselves in the rich tapestry of Asian cultures.

Narita Airport Station

Naritasan Shinshoji Temple: This stunning Buddhist temple, established over 1,000 years ago, features a large pagoda, a beautiful garden, and traditional Japanese architecture. It's a serene spot to reflect and unwind after a flight.

Narita-san Park: Adjacent to Shinshoji Temple, this park is famous for its seasonal beauty, particularly cherry blossoms in spring and colorful foliage in autumn. It's a great place for a leisurely stroll or a picnic with a view of the temple.

Nippori Station

Yanaka Ginza: A step back in time, this charming shopping street captivates with its Showa-era atmosphere, offering traditional snacks, artisan crafts, and a glimpse into Tokyo's past. It's a haven for those looking to experience the city's less-commercialized side.

The Fabric Town: Nippori's Fabric Town is a paradise for craft enthusiasts and anyone looking to explore Tokyo's textile industry. Rows of shops offer an array of fabrics, from traditional Japanese prints to modern patterns, making it a unique spot for finding special souvenirs.

Aoto Station
